gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IGameState, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements IGameState, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    Graphical interface implementation

    The GUI class communicates with Logic or Client, using the ICommand interface. This class will listen for key presses, and notify the game logic.

    Author:
    Balint Dobszay
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GUI

        public GUI()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor of GUI. Creates and displays the game window. Initializes game progress variables, calls the methods to build the game environment.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error when reading resource images

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Entry point of the application. Instantiates the GUI class, and starts timer for refreshing the window for animations.
        Parameters:
        args - not used

      • BuildStatusbar

        private void BuildStatusbar()
        Creates elements for the status bar at the bottom of the window.

      • BuildDrawPanel

        private void BuildDrawPanel()
        Creates the main draw area of the game.

      • ReadResourceImages

        private void ReadResourceImages()
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the picture files that are the elements of a game map. Creates key-value pairs between field type and image name.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if error when reading resource images

      • BuildMenu

        private void BuildMenu()
        Builds the structure of the menu bar at the top of the game window. The Logic or Client classes are instantiated here, if a new game is started.

      • openMapDialog

        private java.lang.String openMapDialog()
        Opens a file chooser window, used for selecting a game map.
        Returns:
        Path of selected file if OK is pressed, empty string if cancel is pressed.

      • updateStatusBar

        private void updateStatusBar()
        Updates the game status, number of moves, and keyboard settings info in the status bar.

      • updateTime

        private void updateTime()
        Updates the elapsed time info in the status bar.

      • buildKeyboardMaps

        private void buildKeyboardMaps()
        Creates key-value pair relation between pressed key and caused player movement.

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Not used, needed because of the KeyListener interface.
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - pressed key event

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        If a keypress is catched, this method will be called. It selects the necessary player movement based on the pressed key, and sends it to the game logic. Displays error message if there is no game in progress.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - pressed key event

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Not used, needed because of the KeyListener interface.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener
        Parameters:
        e - pressed key event

      • onNewGameState

        public void onNewGameState(GameState g)
        This is the communication point with the game logic. If there is a happening in the game, the logic will notify the GUI using this method. The GUI will draw the new fields or update the parameters based on the received new gamestate.
        Specified by:
        onNewGameState in interface IGameState
        Parameters:
        g - new gamestate

      • refreshAnimations

        private void refreshAnimations()
        This method is called by the timer in the main method, every 10 msec. If there is an animation in progress, it will calculate the necessary movement of the fields and repaint. When the movement animation is done, it will notify the game logic using the ICommand interface. This method also updates the elapsed time label in the status bar.
